column4: i just purchased an external USB IDE HD enclosure.  what do i have to do to mount/recognize it?
it should just popup on the desktop and in 'places'
the drive seems to be running but i dont see it on the desktop
can you type dmesg | tail -n 5 and paste the result in a private window?
unplug it and plug it in again, then run that command and paste the result
now type mount and paste the result
i put ANOTHER drive and repluged it in and it came right up
what is the file system of the drive that is not working?
what is the file system of the drive that is working?
nothing atm i just deleted the partitions and am going to reformat it.  What do u recommend i use?
thats why its not working.  Are you going to use this only under linux? or windows as well?
type sudo mkfs.ext3 /dev/sdc <- based on what you posted it is sdc but VERIFY IT. then unplug and plug back in
thank you for your help and patience
